gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Thorium-234 Total and Uranium-238 from the U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT,EPZT TEI Rates projects of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Water-column total Th-234 and U-238 the 2013 U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT cruise. Dataset Description: <p>Water-column total Th-234 with 4 L method and U-238 from U-salinity relationship from the 2013 U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT cruise.</p> Acquisition Description: <p><strong>Sampling details:</strong><br /><em><strong>Super stations:</strong> </em>approximately 28 discrete total <sup>234</sup>Th samples were collected throughout the water column, a minimum of 12 depths were chosen in the upper 1000 m.&nbsp;<br /><em><strong>Full stations:</strong>&nbsp;</em>approximately 20 discrete total <sup>234</sup>Th samples were collected throughout the water column, a minimum of 12 depths were chosen in the upper 1000 m.<br /><strong><em>Hemi station:</em></strong> 16 discrete total <sup>234</sup>Th samples were collected from the upper 3000 m.&nbsp;<br /><strong><em>Demi and Shelf stations:</em></strong>&nbsp;12 discrete total <sup>234</sup>Th samples were collected, at shelf stations depths spanned the entire water column, at demis the upper 1000 m was sampled.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>The shipboard procedures follow&nbsp;Pike et al. (2005).</p><p><strong>Uranium-238:</strong><br />Value and uncertainty from equation derived in Owens et al. (2011)</p><p>U-238 (dpm/L) = (Salinity * 0.0786) – 0.315</p><p>Salinity was measured on board the ship by the Scripps Ocean Data Facility (ODF).</p><p><strong>Thorium-234:</strong><br />Thorium-234 was determined by the widely-adopted 4 L method. Generally, shallow (&lt; 1000 m) samples were collected from the ODF Rosette and deep samples (&gt;1000 m) were collected from niskin bottles hung above in situ pumps. Data are decay corrected to the mid-point time between when bottles 1 and 12 were fired for shallow casts, when the messenger was dropped for deep casts, and the time of collection for underway samples. All underway samples were collected directly from the ship’s underway system in the aft ODF wet lab (denoted as bottle 99, cast 0, depth 3 m). All data have been recovery-corrected using the Th-230/Th-229 recovery method (see references below) to account for any loss of sample material during processing. All samples were analyzed using RISO Laboratory Anti-coincidence Beta Counters, using a helium/1% butane mixture. Overall method efficiency was determined by minimizing the percent difference between mean U-238 and Th-234 values for samples from &gt;1000 m to &gt; 500 m from the bottom (45.72 %). Only stations 6 through 16 and 23 through 36 were used to determine method efficiency so as not to include samples with potential coastal or hydrothermal influences.</p><p><strong>Related references:</strong><br />Pike, S.M., K.O. Buesseler, J. Andrews and N. Savoye (2005). Quantification of 234Th recovery in small volume sea water samples by inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. <em>Journal of Radioanalytical and Nuclear Chemistry</em>, 263(2): 355-360.&nbsp;</p><p>Owens, S.A., Buesseler, K.O., and K.W.W. Sims (2011). Re-evaluating the 238 U-salinity relationship in seawater: Implications for the 238 U-234 Th disequilibrium method. Marine Chemistry, 127: 31-39. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.marchem.2011.07.005" target="_blank">10.1016/j.marchem.2011.07.00</a></p><p>Maiti, K., K.O. Buesseler, S.M. Pike, C. Benitez-Nelson, P. Cai, W. Chen, K. Cochran, M. Dai, F. Dehairs, B. Gasser, R.P. Kelly, P. Masque, L.A. Miller, J.C. Miquel, S.B. Moran, P.J. Morris, F. Peine, F. Planchon, A.A. Renfro, M. Rutgers van der Loeff, P.H. Santschi, R. Turnewitsch, J.T. Waples, and C. Xu (2012). Intercalibration studies of short-lived thorium-234 in the water column and marine particles. L&amp;O Methods, 10: 631-644. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.631" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.631</a></p><p>Buesseler, K.O., S. Pike, K. Maiti, C.H. Lamborg, D.A. Siegel and T.W. Trull (2009). Thorium-234 as a tracer of spatial, temporal and vertical variability in particle flux in the North Pacific. Deep-Sea Research I, 56 (1143-1167). doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.dsr.2009.04.001" target="_blank">10.1016/j.dsr.2009.04.001</a></p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1232669 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1232669
Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1231211 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1231211

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: Eastern Tropical Pacific - Transect from Peru to Tahiti

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: U.S. GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: U.S. GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: US GEOTRACES Pacific Zonal Transect: Rates of supply, removal and internal cycling of trace elements and isotopes

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: US GEOTRACES Pacific Zonal Transect: Rates of supply, removal and internal cycling of trace elements and isotopes

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Description from NSF award abstract:​The goal of GEOTRACES is to identify processes and quantify fluxes that control the distribution of trace elements and isotopes (TEIs) in the ocean, and to establish the sensitivity of these distributions to changing environmental conditions. While the distribution of numerous TEIs will be mapped by a large team of GEOTRACES PIs along this transect, their distribution cannot be properly interpreted without concurrent measurement of tracers capable of providing rates of internal TEI cycling processes and fluxes at boundaries and across interfaces. Naturally-occurring radioisotopes of the Uranium-Thorium series are well suited for studying the sources and sinks of TEIs on time and space scales necessary to interpret lateral and vertical TEI distributions.In this project, a research team from the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution and the University of South Carolina at Columbia will carry out measurement of a suite of uranium/thorium series radionuclides on the US GEOTRACES cruise to the Eastern Tropical South Pacific (ETSP) Ocean. This radiotracer suite will include shorter-lived 234Th and 228Th as well as the radium quartet (224Ra, 223Ra, 228Ra, 226Ra), which together allow the quantification of rates of horizontal and vertical transport and mixing, as well as removal at ocean boundaries, surface export, and subsurface remineralization.
Eastern Tropical Pacific - Transect from Peru to Tahiti

Thompson. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651557.rdf Name: SECT_ID Units: dimensionless Description: GEOTRACES cruise name. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651558.rdf Name: STNNBR Units: dimensionless Description: Station number. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651559.rdf Name: GEOTRC_SAMPNO Units: dimensionless Description: GEOTRACES sample number. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651560.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude, as reported by the PI. Negative = South. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651561.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude, as reported by the PI. Negative = West. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651562.rdf Name: GEOTRC_EVENTNO Units: dimensionless Description: GEOTRACES event number. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651563.rdf Name: CASTNO Units: dimensionless Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station; Underway samples are denoted as cast 0 but coincided with the shallow demi ODF rosette casts (see date_GMT and time_GMT). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651564.rdf Name: date_GMT Units: YYYYmmdd Description: 8-digit combination of year, month, day (GMT), as reported by the PI. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651565.rdf Name: time_GMT Units: HHMM Description: Time (GMT); 24-hour clock, as reported by the PI. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651566.rdf Name: bottle Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 12; The majority of samples were taken from niskins (from either the ODF Rosette or pump cast-associated niskins); Underway samples are denoted as bottle number 99 because they do not have a bottle number. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651567.rdf Name: depth Units: meters Description: Actual sample depth, as reported by the PI; For samples taken off the ODF Rosette the sample depths in meters were calculated from CTD pressure; For samples taken off the pump cast-associated niskins a pressure sensor was also used to calculate depths with adjustments for changes in wire angle throughout the 4 hour pumping period (See cruise report for additional details). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651568.rdf Name: U_238_TD_CONC_BOTTLE Units: dpm/Liter Description: Total Uranium-238 activity. Includes dissolved + particulate (though particulate fraction is very small). This measurment is calculated from salinity (it’s a conservative relationship); it is not measured directly. Samples collected by Niskin bottle. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651569.rdf Name: U_238_TD_CONC_BOTTLE_unc Units: dpm/Liter Description: U_238_TD_CONC_BOTTLE uncertainty. Derived from the uncertainty in the relationship in Owens et al. (2011). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651570.rdf Name: Th_234_TD_CONC_BOTTLE Units: dpm/Liter Description: Total dissolvable Thorium-234 activity (particulate AND dissolved matter). Samples collected by Niskin bottle. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651571.rdf Name: Th_234_TD_CONC_BOTTLE_unc Units: dpm/Liter Description: Th_234_TD_CONC_BOTTLE uncertainty. Derived from counting statistics and error propagation for mass/volume measurements and ICP-MS recovery analysis. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651572.rdf Name: U_238_TD_CONC_PUMP Units: dpm/Liter Description: Total Uranium-238 activity. Includes dissolved + particulate (though particulate fraction is very small). This measurment is calculated from salinity (it’s a conservative relationship); it is not measured directly. Samples collected by McLane pump. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651573.rdf Name: U_238_TD_CONC_PUMP_unc Units: dpm/Liter Description: U_238_TD_CONC_PUMP uncertainty. Derived from the uncertainty in the relationship in Owens et al. (2011). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/651574.rdf Name: Th_234_TD_CONC_PUMP Units: dpm/Liter Description: Total dissolvable Thorium-234 activity (particulate AND dissolved matter). Includes dissolved + particulate (though particulate fraction is very small). This measurment is calculated from salinity (it’s a conservative relationship); it is not measured directly. gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Cruise identifier. TN = R/V Thomas G. Thompson.; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES cruise name.; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: Station number.; General Description: station number; generally sequential; a unique number designating a general geographic location at which one or more sampling activities may occur.* Please use station rather than sta

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES sample number.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Latitude, as reported by the PI. Negative = South.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude, as reported by the PI. Negative = West.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES event number.; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier, numbered consecutively within a station; Underway samples are denoted as cast 0 but coincided with the shallow demi ODF rosette casts (see date_GMT and time_GMT).; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: 8-digit combination of year, month, day (GMT), as reported by the PI.; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: Time (GMT); 24-hour clock, as reported by the PI.; General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 12; The majority of samples were taken from niskins (from either the ODF Rosette or pump cast-associated niskins); Underway samples are denoted as bottle number 99 because they do not have a bottle number.; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Actual sample depth, as reported by the PI; For samples taken off the ODF Rosette the sample depths in meters were calculated from CTD pressure; For samples taken off the pump cast-associated niskins a pressure sensor was also used to calculate depths with adjustments for changes in wire angle throughout the 4 hour pumping period (See cruise report for additional details).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Total Uranium-238 activity. Includes dissolved + particulate (though particulate fraction is very small). This measurment is calculated from salinity (it’s a conservative relationship); it is not measured directly. Samples collected by Niskin bottle.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: U_238_TD_CONC_BOTTLE uncertainty. Derived from the uncertainty in the relationship in Owens et al. (2011).; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Total dissolvable Thorium-234 activity (particulate AND dissolved matter). Samples collected by Niskin bottle.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: Th_234_TD_CONC_BOTTLE uncertainty. Derived from counting statistics and error propagation for mass/volume measurements and ICP-MS recovery analysis.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Total Uranium-238 activity. Includes dissolved + particulate (though particulate fraction is very small). This measurment is calculated from salinity (it’s a conservative relationship); it is not measured directly. Samples collected by McLane pump.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: U_238_TD_CONC_PUMP uncertainty. Derived from the uncertainty in the relationship in Owens et al. (2011).; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Total dissolvable Thorium-234 activity (particulate AND dissolved matter). Samples collected by McLane Pump.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: Th_234_TD_CONC_PUMP uncertainty. Derived from counting statistics and error propagation for mass/volume measurements and ICP-MS recovery analysis.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Total Uranium-238 activity. Includes dissolved + particulate (though particulate fraction is very small). This measurment is calculated from salinity (it’s a conservative relationship); it is not measured directly. Samples collected by GeoFish.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: U_238_TD_CONC_FISH uncertainty. Derived from the uncertainty in the relationship in Owens et al. (2011).; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Total dissolvable Thorium-234 activity (particulate AND dissolved matter). Samples collected by GeoFish.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: Th_234_TD_CONC_FISH uncertainty. Derived from counting statistics and error propagation for mass/volume measurements and ICP-MS recovery analysis.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Total Uranium-238 activity. Includes dissolved + particulate (though particulate fraction is very small). This measurment is calculated from salinity (it’s a conservative relationship); it is not measured directly. Samples collected by the ship's underway system..; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: U_238_TD_CONC_UWAY uncertainty. Derived from the uncertainty in the relationship in Owens et al. (2011).; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: Total dissolvable Thorium-234 activity (particulate AND dissolved matter). Samples collected by the ship's underway system.; General Description: Concentration of a trace metal in seawater. Refer to dataset for element name and units. NERC Description: Parameters pertaining to metal and trace metalloid (i.e. excluding Si) concentrations in any material.

PI-supplied Description: Th_234_TD_CONC_UWAY uncertainty. Derived from counting statistics and error propagation for mass/volume measurements and ICP-MS recovery analysis.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES sampling instrument, according to event log.; General Description: instrument used to collect or process data, definition is specific to the data set in which it appears

PI-supplied Description: Bottle sample number, according to bottle file.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: Bottle number, according to bottle file.; General Description: Niskin sample bottle number

PI-supplied Description: WOCE bottle quality flag.; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) at the start of the sampling event, according to the event log. Formatted to ISO 8601 standard.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Latitude, according to the event log.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude, according to the event log.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) when bottle was fired, according to the bottle file. Formatted to ISO 8601 standard.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Longitude when the bottle was fired, according to the bottle file.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>Sampling details:</strong><br /><em><strong>Super stations:</strong> </em>approximately 28 discrete total <sup>234</sup>Th samples were collected throughout the water column, a minimum of 12 depths were chosen in the upper 1000 m.&nbsp;<br /><em><strong>Full stations:</strong>&nbsp;</em>approximately 20 discrete total <sup>234</sup>Th samples were collected throughout the water column, a minimum of 12 depths were chosen in the upper 1000 m.<br /><strong><em>Hemi station:</em></strong> 16 discrete total <sup>234</sup>Th samples were collected from the upper 3000 m.&nbsp;<br /><strong><em>Demi and Shelf stations:</em></strong>&nbsp;12 discrete total <sup>234</sup>Th samples were collected, at shelf stations depths spanned the entire water column, at demis the upper 1000 m was sampled.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p>The shipboard procedures follow&nbsp;Pike et al. (2005).</p><p><strong>Uranium-238:</strong><br />Value and uncertainty from equation derived in Owens et al. (2011)</p><p>U-238 (dpm/L) = (Salinity * 0.0786) – 0.315</p><p>Salinity was measured on board the ship by the Scripps Ocean Data Facility (ODF).</p><p><strong>Thorium-234:</strong><br />Thorium-234 was determined by the widely-adopted 4 L method. Generally, shallow (&lt; 1000 m) samples were collected from the ODF Rosette and deep samples (&gt;1000 m) were collected from niskin bottles hung above in situ pumps. Data are decay corrected to the mid-point time between when bottles 1 and 12 were fired for shallow casts, when the messenger was dropped for deep casts, and the time of collection for underway samples. All underway samples were collected directly from the ship’s underway system in the aft ODF wet lab (denoted as bottle 99, cast 0, depth 3 m). All data have been recovery-corrected using the Th-230/Th-229 recovery method (see references below) to account for any loss of sample material during processing. All samples were analyzed using RISO Laboratory Anti-coincidence Beta Counters, using a helium/1% butane mixture. Overall method efficiency was determined by minimizing the percent difference between mean U-238 and Th-234 values for samples from &gt;1000 m to &gt; 500 m from the bottom (45.72 %). Only stations 6 through 16 and 23 through 36 were used to determine method efficiency so as not to include samples with potential coastal or hydrothermal influences.</p><p><strong>Related references:</strong><br />Pike, S.M., K.O. Buesseler, J. Andrews and N. Savoye (2005). Quantification of 234Th recovery in small volume sea water samples by inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry. <em>Journal of Radioanalytical and Nuclear Chemistry</em>, 263(2): 355-360.&nbsp;</p><p>Owens, S.A., Buesseler, K.O., and K.W.W. Sims (2011). Re-evaluating the 238 U-salinity relationship in seawater: Implications for the 238 U-234 Th disequilibrium method. Marine Chemistry, 127: 31-39. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.marchem.2011.07.005" target="_blank">10.1016/j.marchem.2011.07.00</a></p><p>Maiti, K., K.O. Buesseler, S.M. Pike, C. Benitez-Nelson, P. Cai, W. Chen, K. Cochran, M. Dai, F. Dehairs, B. Gasser, R.P. Kelly, P. Masque, L.A. Miller, J.C. Miquel, S.B. Moran, P.J. Morris, F. Peine, F. Planchon, A.A. Renfro, M. Rutgers van der Loeff, P.H. Santschi, R. Turnewitsch, J.T. Waples, and C. Xu (2012). Intercalibration studies of short-lived thorium-234 in the water column and marine particles. L&amp;O Methods, 10: 631-644. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2012.10.631" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2012.10.631</a></p><p>Buesseler, K.O., S. Pike, K. Maiti, C.H. Lamborg, D.A. Siegel and T.W. Trull (2009). Thorium-234 as a tracer of spatial, temporal and vertical variability in particle flux in the North Pacific. Deep-Sea Research I, 56 (1143-1167). doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.dsr.2009.04.001" target="_blank">10.1016/j.dsr.2009.04.001</a></p>

<p><strong>Detection Limits:</strong> Limits of detection are not reported because they are not applicable to the <sup>234</sup>Th beta counting method.&nbsp;A ‘non-detect’ for <sup>234</sup>Th or a case where there is no <sup>234</sup>Th present (initially or after 6 months of decay) will still result in a measureable amount of background radioactivity due to the beta decay of long lived natural radionuclides that are also carried by the Mn precipitate used in the shipboard sample processing.&nbsp;These background values are utilized and therefore, they are not reported as a non-detections of <sup>234</sup>Th.</p><p><strong>Uncertainty:</strong> At the start and conclusion of each cruise, high activity <sup>238</sup>U standards and background counts (empty detectors) were measured to confirm correct operation of the RISØ detectors and to determine detector to detector variability.&nbsp;The reported uncertainty on each total <sup>234</sup>Th measurement represents the propagated counting uncertainty, volume (pipettes) and weighing (scales) uncertainties, and detector to detector normalization.&nbsp;Counting uncertainty is generally the largest source of uncertainty so whenever possible samples were counted until errors were below 5%.</p><p><strong>Inter-calibration Efforts:</strong> Results from the GEOTRACES <sup>234</sup>Th inter-calibration efforts are published in Maiti et al. (2012).&nbsp;Fifteen labs participated in two cruises that centered on particulate, total and dissolved <sup>234</sup>Th inter-calibration.&nbsp; Total <sup>234</sup>Th was assessed on the 2009 GEOTRACES inter-calibration cruise.&nbsp;A short excerpt from Maiti et al. (2012) is included below that summarized the results and recommendations for total <sup>234</sup>Th shipboard analyses:</p><p><em>‘Total <sup>234</sup>Th inter-calibration results for deep water samples showed good agreement amongst laboratories. The mean <sup>234</sup>Th activity of 2.433 ± 0.035 dpm L<sup>–1</sup> for all laboratories was also found to be in very good agreement with the salinity derived expected <sup>234</sup>Th activity of 2.442 ± 0.0003 dpm L<sup>–1</sup>, assuming secular equilibrium. However in comparison, the <sup>234</sup>Th activities from SBB [Santa Barbara Basin] surface water had much more variability because of lower initial activity and large ingrowth corrections from <sup>238</sup>U. It is thus recommended to keep the time between collection and filtering to a minimum in order to keep in-growth corrections to a minimum. This also reduces the error associated with the uncertainties in both salinity measurements and the <sup>238</sup>U-salinity relationship as the error is propagated when ingrowth corrections are made.’</em></p><p>Because of the short half-life of <sup>234</sup>Th (~24 days), the nature of radionuclide analyses, and the recommendations stated above, inter-calibration between multiple labs was not possible during the 59-day GP16 cruise.&nbsp;Therefore, internal quality control was a priority and addressed in the following ways.&nbsp;First, five replicate deep water samples were analyzed to determine the degree of reproducibility.&nbsp;These samples were collected from the same niskin bottle and processed simultaneously.&nbsp;The results of this analysis are incorporated into the sample measurement uncertainty.&nbsp;Second, the shallow, intermediate, and deep pump casts were made to overlap to provide some means of assessing cast to cast differences and reproducibility.&nbsp;While conditions can change during the duration of a pump cast (~4 hours) as well as from one cast to the next, noticeable differences (larger than expected for natural variability) in overlapping casts were only observed at one station during GP16.&nbsp;This&nbsp;suggested a high degree of reproducibility was achieved for mid-water column total <sup>234</sup>Th. Third, all filters measured for total <sup>234</sup>Th were counted twice aboard ship (second count within a few days of the first) and immediately compared to salinity-derived <sup>238</sup>U values.&nbsp;Any abnormal deviations were flagged (&gt;10% between counting results) and the filter was run a third time if necessary.&nbsp;These two counts were averaged for each sample to get a final ‘total <sup>234</sup>Th' for that depth and location.&nbsp;Lastly, the same internal uranium standards were used by the Buesseler lab during the NAZT and EPZT GEOTRACES cruises and will continue to be used on future cruises. These standards provide a consistent means for calibration and comparison.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Problem reporting:</strong><br />Data were flagged with quality indicators:<br />1 = Good;<br />2 = Probably Good;<br />4 = Bad.</p><p>The dataset uses standard Ocean Data View data flags (See <a href="https://www.bodc.ac.uk/data/codes_and_formats/odv_format/" target="_blank">https://www.bodc.ac.uk/data/codes_and_formats/odv_format/</a>).&nbsp;Two samples were marked as ‘4’ or ‘bad values’ due to issues encountered during sample filtration.&nbsp;Because of the obvious poor quality of these data the total Thorium-234 values were not included.&nbsp;A few samples were denoted as ‘2’ or ‘probably good’ because of a pipetting issue affecting individual sample recovery calculations.&nbsp;Average recoveries for the surrounding water column depths were used for these samples.&nbsp;Accordingly, uncertainty values were increased for these samples.</p><p><strong>BCO-DMO Processing:</strong><br />- modified parameter names to conform with BCO-DMO and GEOTRACES naming conventions:<br />- replaced blanks (missing data) with 'nd' ('no data');<br />- created separate&nbsp;columsn for bottle, pump, GeoFish, and underway samples; re-arranged data accordingly (in accordance with GEOTRACES IDP naming standards).</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong><br />As was done for the GEOTRACES-NAT data, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters:</p><p>cruise_id, EXPOCODE,SECT_ID, STNNBR, CASTNO, GEOTRC_EVENTNO, GEOTRC_SAMPNO, GEOTRC_INSTR, SAMPNO, GF_NO, BTLNBR, BTLNBR_FLAG_W, DATE_START_EVENT, TIME_START_EVENT, ISO_DATETIME_UTC_START_EVENT, EVENT_LAT, EVENT_LON, DEPTH_MIN, DEPTH_MAX, &nbsp;BTL_DATE, BTL_TIME, BTL_ISO_DATETIME_UTC, BTL_LAT, BTL_LON, ODF_CTDPRS, SMDEPTH, FMDEPTH, BTMDEPTH, CTDPRS, CTDDEPTH.</p><p>This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.</p><p>Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle and ODF_Bottle datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the TN303 Event Log (version 30 Oct 2014). Where applicable, pump information was taken from the PUMP_Nuts_Sals dataset.</p><p>A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.</p><p>If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.</p><p>See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Niskin bottle PI Supplied Instrument Description:Shallow samples for Th-234 were taken using the ODF Rosette (12 30-Liter niskin bottles) and deep samples were taken using niskin bottles hung above in-situ pumps. Instrument Name: Niskin bottle Instrument Short Name:Niskin bottle Instrument Description: A Niskin bottle (a next generation water sampler based on the Nansen bottle) is a cylindrical, non-metallic water collection device with stoppers at both ends. The bottles can be attached individually on a hydrowire or deployed in 12, 24 or 36 bottle Rosette systems mounted on a frame and combined with a CTD. Niskin bottles are used to collect discrete water samples for a range of measurements including pigments, nutrients, plankton, etc. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0412/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Instrument Name: GeoFish Towed near-Surface Sampler Instrument Short Name:GeoFish Instrument Description: The GeoFish towed sampler is a custom designed near surface (<2m) sampling system for the collection of trace metal clean seawater. It consists of a PVC encapsulated lead weighted torpedo and separate PVC depressor vane supporting the intake utilizing all PFA Teflon tubing connected to a deck mounted, air-driven, PFA Teflon dual-diaphragm pump which provides trace-metal clean seawater at up to 3.7L/min. The GeoFish is towed at up to 13kts off to the side of the vessel outside of the ship's wake to avoid possible contamination from the ship's hull. It was developed by Geoffrey Smith and Ken Bruland (University of California, Santa Cruz). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/31/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Instrument Name: McLane Pump Instrument Short Name:McLane Pump Instrument Description: McLane pumps sample large volumes of seawater at depth. They are attached to a wire and lowered to different depths in the ocean. As the water is pumped through the filter, particles suspended in the ocean are collected on the filters. The pumps are then retrieved and the contents of the filters are analyzed in a lab.

PI Supplied Instrument Name: RISO Laboratory Anti-coincidence Beta Counters PI Supplied Instrument Description:Th-234 samples were analyzed using a Riso Anti-coincidence Beta Counter using a helium/1% butane mixture. Instrument Name: Riso Laboratory Anti-coincidence Beta Counters Instrument Short Name:Riso Beta Counter Instrument Description: Low-level beta detectors manufactured by Riso (now Nutech) in Denmark. These instruments accept samples that can be mounted on a 25mm filter holder. These detectors have very low backgrounds, 0.17 counts per minute, and can have counting efficiencies as high as 55%.See:http://cafethorium.whoi.edu/website/about/services_radioanalytical_facility_equip.htmlandhttp://www.nutech.dtu.dk/Produkter/Dosimetri/NUK_instruments/GM_multicounter.aspx

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
